ygData.subject: Re: Dumb People
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe - I feel for ya! Last group I left over similar situation.  The leader was doing dumb stuff - trying to killsteal, not sharing spawns, arguing with other
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe - I feel for ya!

Last group I left over similar situation. The leader was doing dumb stuff -
trying to killsteal, not sharing spawns, arguing with other campers, etc.
So, finally someone says lets go to this bandit camp... I say no, we are too
low for them. Leader say no, we can take em. I say, bye bye!

Not five minutes later, I am standing on a path by a hut with no guards
talking to some adventurers when former leader trains bandit camp on top of
use 'cuz he thinks this hut has guards. I left the group cuz I dint want
this idjit to git me keeled but he managed to keel me anyways! <oh well
living and dieing in Norrath>

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: Roop Dirump [mailto:roop@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 07, 1999 11:24 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Dumb People

From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>

Alright the mage thinks to themselves, I need a nice safe
place to meditate.
Hm, this bridge here should be safe. When folks train the
really tough
monsters like that big Proon, they'll most certainly bring
him this way.
Yes, I'll sit down right here, because I can be most certain
this is where
Proon will be standing angrily when the fleeing person is
gone. And I will
have no time to even stand up before I'm dead! Perfect! Oh
that rivershore
nearby is far too safe, Proon might not see me, completely
unacceptable.

I cannot believe the angry shouts from these people, angry
they were not
warned Proon was coming. Dumb people.

Today was the first day I actually quit a group and actually
informed them
it was because they were such a bad group. Usually I am
more discreet,
because the bad players actually try to be good players, and
may learn one
day. But this group, from their idiotic banter, to their
actions, arrgh!
They got me killed by all four, not just one, the whole
dullard lot of them
chasing after a hurt monster, happily slashing away.
Meanwhile the bard is
left to fend for himself! Not only that, I was stacking
Hymn and Anthem...
with another bard in the group, playing... of all things,
Accelerando!
During battle! He told me he was playing it because we
might have to flee.
For the whole battle, he plays it, for when we flee.....
<<rolls eyes>>

I think bards may have a bad reputation by the dumb people
who like just one
song, likely the entire basis of their class-choice, and
play this song even
at the innapropriate times! This fool-bard also mentioned
he was twinked so
heavily because he sold crack. "Only the gods can help me
now!" I thought,
and they didn't.

Roop
